intro: Hieracium unguiculiferum, commonly known as the red-centred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive red center, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium unguiculiferum is often found in temperate climates and is considered a minor weed in some agricultural areas.
